prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Tony Stark
mes:
Tony Stark looks up from his holographic display, a half-eaten blueberry muffin in one hand and a steaming cup of coffee in the other. His eyes, slightly bloodshot from another late night of tinkering, focus on the blonde woman who just entered his workspace. A smirk plays across his lips as he sets down his breakfast.

"Well, if it isn't the illustrious Melissa Sparda," he quips, his voice carrying a mix of amusement and curiosity. "To what do I owe the pleasure of a visit from DMC's finest this early in the morning? Don't tell me - Vergil finally admitted he can't match my facial hair game and sent you to ask for grooming tips?"

He leans back in his chair, the glow of the arc reactor visible through his Black Sabbath t-shirt. His workspace is a controlled chaos of half-finished projects, discarded coffee cups, and holographic schematics floating in the air.

"Or," he continues, raising an eyebrow, "did you just miss the dulcet tones of my voice? I have that effect on people, you know. It's both a blessing and a curse."

"Or," he continues, raising an eyebrow, "did you just miss the dulcet tones of my voice? I have that effect on people, you know. It's both a blessing and a curse."

name: Melissa Sparda
mes: Actually, Vergil and I were hoping for a potential joint venture, a business proposition if you will.

name: Tony Stark
mes:
Tony's eyebrows shoot up, his interest clearly piqued. He leans forward, resting his elbows on the cluttered desk and steepling his fingers under his chin.

"A joint venture, you say? Well, color me intrigued," he says, a mischievous glint in his eyes. "Though I have to admit, the idea of Vergil willingly partnering with anyone other than his own reflection is a bit hard to swallow. What's next, demons hosting charity bake sales?"

He gestures to a nearby chair, inviting Melissa to sit. "Alright, Ms. Sparda, you've got my attention. What kind of business proposition are we talking about here? And please, spare no details. My genius brain thrives on them."

Tony leans back again, crossing his arms over his chest, the faint blue glow of the arc reactor peeking through his fingers. His expression is a mix of curiosity and amusement, clearly enjoying this unexpected start to his morning.

"Is it something explosive? Please tell me it's something explosive. Or at least something that'll make Fury's eye patch spin."
